TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StylusPointPropertyInfo extends System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty

Docs.summary: Specifies the constraints of a property in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The StylusPointPropertyInfo class inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperty> class and generates the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo.Minimum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo.Resolution%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo.Unit%2A> values used to define the properties of a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint>. The validity of each property value varies depending on the manufacture of the digitizer and stylus.
## Examples The following example creates an <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> object from a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> and gets the information for each StylusPointPropertyInfo in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.

Docs.summary: Gets the scale that converts a property value into units.
Docs.value: The scale that converts a property value into units.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Multiply the resolution by the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> property to get its unit-based value. For example, if a property's value is 100, the unit is inches, and the resolution is .01, then multiplying 100 by .01 reveals that the value of that property is 1 inch.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> object from a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> and gets the information for each <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo> in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.
